sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>tsunami</radical> dug out a chunk of the land and now it looks like a big <radical>red</radical> <radical>bow</radical>. It's a <kanji>gulf</kanji> now!
meaningInfo: Picture all the famous gulfs you learned about in geography class. Most of them look like someone pressed a bow into them and dug out the land. (And just imagine they're red because the earth is bleeding, making the sand red.)
readingMnemonic: How many tsunamis does it take to make a <kanji>gulf</kanji>? Just <reading>one</reading> (<ja>わん</ja>). If there were more, then no land would be left behind. It would all be taken into the sea.
readingInfo: Watch one tsunami come in and cut out a chunk of land, leaving behind a big, red gulf.
